page.title: 07INTERVIEW (contd.)
page.content: widened and small green areas or playgrounds have been dotted here and there. The streets are lighter and airier, but the friendly, community spirit still remains, thank goodness. The Crymlyn area nearest to Danygraig used to be littered with derelict factories, but further to the east, along the canal were lovely walks. I remember the wild yellow irises and other wild flowers which I can't put a name to. There were animals and birds too - especially swans which lived along the canal bank. The plans for the whole Crymlyn area will make sure that the Bog wi ll be like that again. There will be open spaces for birds and animals but particularly for people who can go and enjoy it _ that's what the Crymlyn Bog is all about.
